column1: <s>[INST] A penny for your thoughts. [/INST] This phrase is used to ask someone what they are thinking about, especially when they seem deep in thought.</s>
<s>[INST] Actions speak louder than words. [/INST] This maxim suggests that what a person actually does is more important than what they say they will do.</s>
<s>[INST] An apple a day keeps the doctor away. [/INST] This saying promotes the idea that eating healthy, particularly fruits, can lead to better overall health.</s>
<s>[INST] Barking up the wrong tree. [/INST] This idiom means to make a mistake or a false assumption in something you are trying to achieve.</s>
<s>[INST] Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. [/INST] This phrase means that beauty is subjective and different people have different ideas about what is beautiful.</s>
<s>[INST] Better late than never. [/INST] This saying means that it's better to do something late than not do it at all.</s>
<s>[INST] Don't count your chickens before they hatch. [/INST] This means you shouldn't assume success or make plans based on future events that may not happen.</s>
<s>[INST] Every cloud has a silver lining. [/INST] This means that there is something good in every bad situation.</s>
<s>[INST] Fortune favors the bold. [/INST] This maxim suggests that people who take risks are more likely to succeed than those who choose to play it safe.</s>
<s>[INST] Hit the nail on the head. [/INST] This means to describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem.</s>
